description:
One of my favorite hike to do within a half hour of Halifax.  Not sure why I’m posting though…it’s so nice to have some secret spots!   However it is also nice to share some of these hidden gems to like minded people!
Yes we do have an entry in trailpeak to Pollys Cove but this is very much different as this post will lead you to a fantastic little place called Crack in rock cave.  Ok, it’s not a cave in the true sense but it is still amazing.  The granite rock here as a fairly long crack of over 20 ft in height and perhaps 200ft long.  You can actually enter the crack go to the end of the straight line where the crack does a 90 degree turn before doing a small ascension of the 20 ft.  At the end of the day, you pop out of a small hole in the shrubs looking like a gopher!
directions: The trailhead for the hike is on highway 333 east of Peggys Cove at; N44° 29' 36.8" W63° 53' 22.6" and the “cave” is on a wide rocky ledge (no problem at high tide) approximately at; N44° 29' 19.1" W63° 52' 54.0"
title: Crack in Rock Cave
